caption: Table 1: Summary statistics of the underlying graphs used in our experiments.
description: This table summarizes the characteristics of the graphs used in the experiments presented in the paper.  For each graph, it lists the type (synthetic or real-world), the underlying function optimized on that graph, the search space (node subsets or edge subsets), the specific type of graph (e.g., Barabási-Albert, Watts-Strogatz, Stochastic Block Model, etc.), and the number of nodes and edges in the graph.

caption: Table 2: Summary of some common kernels on graphs.
description: This table summarizes four common kernels used in graph Gaussian processes: Diffusion, Polynomial, Sum-of-Inverse Polynomials, and Diffusion with ARD.  For each kernel, it lists the regularization function  r(λp) applied to the eigenvalues λp and the resulting kernel function Kn(vi, vj) which is used to measure the similarity between combo-nodes vi and vj in the combo-graph. The regularization functions incorporate hyperparameters (β's and ε) that control the smoothness and complexity of the kernel.
